abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Public Sector
            Capacity Building Project in Pakistan is to improve the
            Government's capacity to implement its on-going
            economic reform program. Focusing on strategic areas, the
            project will have three distinct capacity building
            objectives: 1) broad-based professional development of
            public sector officers; 2) capacity enhancement in key
            ministries and agencies at the forefront of design,
            implementation and monitoring of policy reforms; and 3)
            strengthening of regulatory agencies. The Civil Service
            restructuring is a significant administrative feature of the
            Civil Service Reforms under the Economic Revival Program of
            1999. The first component will address the capacity, and
            technical skills gap in the civil service, largely focusing
            on the professional development of federal and provincial
            civil service, and ex-cadre officers. It will be undertaken
            through a professional training program, on priority areas
            for degree programs abroad, and, in-country training
            capacity through support of training institutions. The civil
            service recruitment process will be improved through support
            to the Federal Public Service Commission. The second
            component will strengthen economic policy and management,
            through capacity building of key federal and provincial
            ministries and divisions, including finance, planning,
            commerce, central board of revenue, etc., who are in the
            vanguard of design and implementation of the reform agenda.
            Finally, the third component will support capacity building
            of the newly established regulatory agencies through a
            specialized training of officers, and, specialized technical
            consultancies for analytical studies, and, includes
            procurement of equipment and related materials. An
            unallocated amount will be disbursed to interested
            ministries/agencies, once their individual proposals are
            approved by the National Steering and Coordination Committee (NSCC).
